newsitem.title: USA: CBOT rice closes sharply lower on export sales.
newsitem.headline: CBOT rice closes sharply lower on export sales.

text.p: CBOT rice futures closed sharply lower on Thursday, battered by USDA weekly export sales that were 70 percent below the previous week, traders said.
"Exports were disappointing," a floor source said. "LIT was an aggressive seller on the way down."
USDA on Thursday put weekly export sales at 4,900 tonnes, down 70 percent from last week and 80 percent from the four-week average.
Traders also pointed to uncertainty on the export front amid reports Costa Rica extended the deadline for its tender. Costa Rica has cancelled several tenders recently.
Floor sources said the trade was skeptical Costa Rica would complete the tender.
Rice ended 18 to three cents per cwt lower with July down 13 at $11.18.
Volume was estimated by CBOT at 250 lots, compared with Wednesday's actual volume of 381 lots.
